This file is a merged representation of the entire codebase, combined into a single document.
Generated by Repomix on: 2025-03-20T12:02:35.929Z

================================================================
File Summary
================================================================

Purpose:
--------
This file contains a packed representation of the entire repository's contents.
It is designed to be easily consumable by AI systems for analysis, code review,
or other automated processes.

File Format:
------------
The content is organized as follows:
1. This summary section
2. Repository information
3. Directory structure
4. Multiple file entries, each consisting of:
  a. A separator line (================)
  b. The file path (File: path/to/file)
  c. Another separator line
  d. The full contents of the file
  e. A blank line

Usage Guidelines:
-----------------
- This file should be treated as read-only. Any changes should be made to the
  original repository files, not this packed version.
- When processing this file, use the file path to distinguish
  between different files in the repository.
- Be aware that this file may contain sensitive information. Handle it with
  the same level of security as you would the original repository.

Notes:
------
- Some files may have been excluded based on .gitignore rules and Repomix's configuration
- Binary files are not included in this packed representation. Please refer to the Repository Structure section for a complete list of file paths, including binary files
- Files matching patterns in .gitignore are excluded
- Files matching default ignore patterns are excluded

Additional Info:
----------------

================
File: .github/workflows/deploy.yml
================
name: Publish to GH Pages
on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:

jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout source
        uses: actions/checkout@v3
        with:
          submodules: true

      - name: Checkout destination
        uses: actions/checkout@v3
        if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
        with:
          ref: gh-pages
          path: built-site

      - name: Setup Hugo
        run: |
          curl -L -o /tmp/hugo.tar.gz 'https://github.com/gohugoio/hugo/releases/download/v0.110.0/hugo_extended_0.110.0_linux-amd64.tar.gz'
          tar -C ${RUNNER_TEMP} -zxvf /tmp/hugo.tar.gz hugo          
      - name: Build
        run: ${RUNNER_TEMP}/hugo

      - name: Deploy
        if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
        run: |
          cp -R public/* ${GITHUB_WORKSPACE}/built-site/
          cd ${GITHUB_WORKSPACE}/built-site
          git add .
          git config user.name 'dhij'
          git config user.email 'davidhwang.ij@gmail.com'
          git commit -m 'Updated site'
          git push

================
File: archetypes/default.md
================
+++
title = "Title"
description = "**atuhor** – description"
date = "2005-03-11"
publishDate = "{{ .Date }}" 
externalLink = "https://svenschnieders.com/"
draft = true
+++

================
File: assets/scss/styles.scss
================
*, :after, :before {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    padding: 0;
}

.description {
    font-size: 0.9rem;  // Smaller than body text
    color: #777;        // Matches .meta class color from theme
    margin: 0;   // Small spacing above and below
    line-height: 1.5;
}
body {
    font: 1rem/1.5 -apple-system,BlinkMacSystemFont,avenir next,avenir,helvetica,helvetica neue,ubuntu,roboto,noto,segoe ui,arial,sans-serif;
    text-rendering: optimizeLegibility;
    -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;
    -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale;
    padding: 1rem;
    //color: #454545;
    //background: hsla(93, 0%, 96%, 1.00);
    color: #000;
    //background-color: #f5f5f5;
}

.skip-link {
  position: absolute;
  top: -40px;
  left: 0;
  //margin: 1.5rem 0;
  background: #eee;
  //color: white;
  //padding: 1.5rem;
  z-index: 100;
}

.skip-link:focus {
  top: 0;
}

h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, strong, b {
    font-size: inherit;
    font-weight: 600;
    //text-transform: uppercase;
}

pre {
    //white-space: pre-wrap;
    //word-break: break-all
}

header {
    //display: flex;
    //justify-content: space-between;
    //padding-bottom: 0.5rem;
    padding-bottom: 0rem;
}

.link {
    overflow: hidden;          // Keep for safety
    text-overflow: ellipsis;   // Optional, can remove if you prefer no truncation
    white-space: normal;       // Change from nowrap to allow wrapping
    text-decoration: none;     // Keep from original
    padding-top: 0.2rem;
  }
  

.time {
	font-variant-numeric: tabular-nums;
	white-space: nowrap;
}

blockquote {
    border-left: 5px solid #eee;
    padding-left: 1rem;
    margin: 0;
}

a,
a:visited {
    color: inherit;
}

a:hover,
a.heading-link {
    text-decoration: none
}

pre {
    padding: .5rem;
    overflow: auto;
    overflow-x: scroll;
    overflow-wrap: normal;
}

code, pre {
    font-family: San Francisco Mono, Monaco, "Consolas", "Lucida Console","DejaVu Sans Mono", "Bitstream Vera Sans Mono", monospace;
    font-size: normal;
    font-size: small;
    background: #eee
}

code {
    padding: .1rem;
    border: none;
}

ul {
    list-style-type: square;
}

ul, ol {
    padding-left: 1.2rem;
}

.list {
    line-height: 2;
    list-style-type: none;
    padding-left: 0;
}

.list li {
    padding-bottom: 0rem;    // Increase from .1rem for more space
    display: flex;
    align-items: baseline;       // Change from flex to block for better stacking
}  

.meta {
    color: #777
}

.content {
    max-width: 70ch;
    margin: 0 auto;
}

header {
    line-height: 2;
    //padding-bottom: 1.5rem;
    //flex-basis: 10rem;
    //flex-grow: 1;
    //position: relative;
    display: flex;
    justify-content: space-between;
    padding-bottom: 1rem;
}

header a {
    text-decoration: none;
}

header ul {
    list-style-type: none;
    padding: 0;
    //border-right: 1px solid #edf2f7;

}

header li, header a {
    //margin-bottom: .2rem;
    //text-align: right;
    //margin-right: 2rem;
    display: inline;
}

h2.post {
    padding-top: .5rem;
}

header ul a:first-child {
    padding-left: 1rem;
}

.nav {
    height: 1px;
    background: #000;
    content: '';
    max-width: 10%;
}

.list li time {
    flex: 0 1 auto;
}

.hr-list {
    margin-top: 0;
    margin-bottom: 0;
    margin-right: .5rem;
    margin-left: .5rem;
    height: 1px;
    border: 0;
    border-bottom: 1px dotted #ccc;
    flex: 1 0 1rem;
    //opacity: .25;
}

.m,
hr {
    border: 0;
    margin: 3rem 0
}

img {
    max-width: 100%;
    height: auto;
}
/* Mobile-specific adjustments */
@media screen and (max-width: 600px) {  // Adjust breakpoint as needed
    .content {
      padding: 1rem;             // Reduce from 2rem for narrower screens
    }
  
    .list li {
      padding-bottom: 0 rem;   // More space between posts
    }
  
    .link {
      font-size: 1rem;           // Ensure readable size
      line-height: 1.4;          // Better spacing for wrapped text
    }
  
    .description {
      font-size: 0.85rem;        // Slightly smaller than desktop (was 0.9rem)
      margin: 0.3rem 0;          // Adjust spacing
    }
  
    .author {
      font-size: 0.8rem;         // Slightly smaller than desktop (was 0.85rem)
      margin: 0.3rem 0;          // Consistent with description
    }
  
    .time {
      font-size: 0.8rem;         // Match author size
    }
  
    .hr-list {
      margin: 0.5rem 0;          // More space around the line
    }
  }

File: content/posts/2arms.md
================
+++
title = "Two Arms and a Head"
description = "**Clayton Atreus** – An unflinching account of the existential horror of paraplegia – both a memoir and a suicide note. About the realities of paralysis, the false optimism of disability culture, and the moral failure of a world that denies people the right to die on their own terms."
date = "2008-03-11"
publishDate = "2025-03-19T11:41:07+01:00" 
externalLink = "https://www.2arms1head.com/"
draft = true
+++

description = "**Julius Krein** – Today’s economy prioritizes financial valuations over real growth, driving U.S. firms to chase short-term asset returns through financial engineering, outsourcing, and disinvestment."
date = "2021-03-08"

title = "The Case for Colonialism"
description = "**Bruce Gilley** – Colonial governance often delivered stability, infrastructure, and economic progress—precisely what vanished after independence. It’s time to reconsider whether colonial-style interventions, done consensually, could help rebuild failing states today."
date = "2018-03-06"
PublishDate = "2025-03-19T11:25:13+01:00"

description = "**Peter Robinson** – Long Covid illustrates how illness, culture, and psychology interact. A neurologist reflects on Havana Syndrome, Long Covid, TikTok Tourette’s, and the rise of functional neurological disorders. As media spreads awareness, it also shapes illness, blurring the line between pathology and perception."
date = "2022-03-11"

================
File: content/about.md
================
+++
title = "About"
description = "About this website"
date = "2005-03-11"
externalLink = "https://svenschnieders.com/"
draft = true
+++
A list of interesting writings curated by Sven Schnieders, writer of the blog [Unfashionable](https://unfashionable.blog/).

New additions appear at the top, with the year indicating an article’s original publication date.

If you have suggestions for additional content or improvements to the AI-generated descriptions, DM [@SvenSchnieders](https://x.com/SvenSchnieders) on Twitter or submit a pull request.

================
File: layouts/_default/_markup/render-heading.html
================
<h{{ .Level }} id="{{ .Anchor | safeURL }}">{{ .Text | safeHTML }} <a href="#{{ .Anchor | safeURL }}" class="hash g">#</a></h{{ .Level }}>

================
File: layouts/_default/_markup/render-image.html
================
{{ $img := imageConfig (add "/static" (.Destination | safeURL)) }}
<img
  src="{{ .Destination | safeURL }}"
  alt="{{ .Text }}"
  loading="lazy"
  decoding="async"
  width="{{ $img.Width }}"
  height="{{ $img.Height }}"
  class="full-width"
/>

================
File: layouts/_default/list.html
================
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
  {{ partial "head.html" . }}
<body>
  <a class="skip-link" href="#main">Skip to main</a>
  <main id="main">
  <div class="content">
    {{ partial "header.html" . }}
    <section>
      <ul reversed class="list">
        {{ range (.Paginate ( where .Site.RegularPages "Section" "posts" ).ByPublishDate.Reverse).Pages }}
          {{ if ne .Kind "section" }}
          <li>
            <a class="link" href="{{ if .Params.externalLink }}{{ .Params.externalLink }}{{ else }}{{ .Permalink }}{{ end }}" title="{{ .Title }}" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">{{ .Title }}</a>
            <hr class="hr-list">
            <time class="g time" datetime="{{ dateFormat "2006-01-02" .Date }}">{{ dateFormat "2006" .Date }}</time>
          </li>
          <p class="description">{{ .Description | markdownify | truncate 280 | safeHTML }}</p>
          {{ end }}
        {{ end }}
      </ul>
    </section>
  </div>
</main>
</body>
</html>

================
File: layouts/_default/single.html
================
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
  {{ partial "head.html" . }}
<body>
  <a class="skip-link" href="#main">Skip to main</a>
<main id="main">
  <div class="content">
    {{ partial "header.html" . }}
      {{ if eq .Type "photos" }}
      <h2>{{ .Title }}</h2>
      {{ end }}
        {{ if eq .Type "photos" }}
      {{ with .Params.image }}
        <img src="{{ . }}"></img>
      {{ end }}</a>
      {{ end }}
      <h2 class="post">{{ .Title }}</h2>
      {{ .Content }}
      {{ if eq .Type "posts" }}
      {{ end }}
      {{ if eq .Title "Projects" }}
      <ul class="list">
        {{ range where .Site.Pages.ByDate.Reverse "Section" "projects" }}
          {{ if ne .Kind "section" }}
          <li>
            <a href="{{ .Permalink }}" title="{{ .Title }}">{{ .Title }}</a>
          </li>
          {{ end }}
        {{ end }}
      </ul>
      {{ end }}
      {{ if eq .Title "Photos" }}
      <ul class="list photos">
        {{ range where .Site.Pages.ByDate.Reverse "Section" "photos" }}
          {{ if ne .Kind "section" }}
          <li>
            <a href="{{ .Permalink }}" title="{{ .Title }}">
            {{ with .Params.image }}
        <img src="{{ . }}"></img>
      {{ end }}</a>
          </li>
          {{ end }}
        {{ end }}
      </ul>
      {{ end }}
  </div>
</main>
</body>
</html>

================
File: layouts/partials/categories.html
================
{{ range $i, $e := .Params.categories -}}
    {{- if $i -}}, {{ end -}}
    <a class="categories" href='{{ "/categories/" | relLangURL }}{{ . | urlize }}'><small>{{ $e | humanize }}</small></a>
{{- end -}}

================
File: layouts/partials/footer.html
================
<footer>
<p>© {{ dateFormat "2006" now }}</p>
      
 </footer>

================
File: layouts/partials/head.html
================
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <meta http-equiv="X-UA-Compatible" content="IE=edge">
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
  <meta name="author" content="Liste - {{ .Site.BaseURL }}">
  <title>{{ if eq .IsHome true }}{{ .Site.Title }}{{ else }}{{ .Title }} | {{ .Site.Title }}{{ end }}</title>
  <meta name="description" content="{{ if ne .Description "" }}{{ .Description }}{{ else }}{{ .Site.Params.description }}{{ end }}">
{{ template "_internal/opengraph.html" . }}
  {{ template "_internal/schema.html" . }}
  {{ template "_internal/twitter_cards.html" . }}
  <link rel="canonical" href="{{ .Permalink | absURL }}">
  <meta name="monetization" content="$twitter.xrptipbot.com/ronaldsvilcins">
  <link rel="dns-prefetch" href="https://www.google-analytics.com">
  <link href="https://www.google-analytics.com" rel="preconnect" crossorigin>
  <link rel="alternate" type="application/atom+xml" title="{{ .Site.Title }}" href="{{ .Site.BaseURL }}atom.xml" />
  <link rel="alternate" type="application/json" title="{{ .Site.Title }}" href="{{ .Site.BaseURL }}feed.json" />
  <link rel="shortcut icon" type="image/svg+xml" href="{{ .Site.Params.logo | absURL }}">
  {{ $styles := resources.Get "scss/styles.scss" | toCSS (dict "outputStyle" "compressed") | minify }}
  <style>{{ $styles.Content | safeCSS }}</style>

  {{ if .IsHome -}}
<script type="application/ld+json">
{
    "@context": "http://schema.org",
    "@type": "WebSite",
    "name": "{{ .Site.Title }}",
    "url": "{{ .Site.BaseURL }}",
    "description": "{{ .Site.Params.description }}",
    "thumbnailUrl": "{{ .Site.Params.Logo | absURL }}",
    "license": "{{ .Site.Params.Copyright }}"
}
</script>
{{ else if .IsPage }}
{{ $author :=  or (.Params.author) (.Site.Author.name) }}
{{ $org_name :=  .Site.Title }}
<script type="application/ld+json">
{
    "@context": "http://schema.org",
    "@type": "BlogPosting",
    "articleSection": "{{ .Section }}",
    "name": "{{ .Title | safeJS }}",
    "headline": "{{ .Title | safeJS }}",
    "alternativeHeadline": "{{ .Params.lead }}",
    "description": "{{ if .Description }}{{ .Description | safeJS }}{{ else }}{{if .IsPage}}{{ .Summary  }}{{ end }}{{ end }}",
    "inLanguage": {{ .Site.LanguageCode | default "en-us" }},
    "isFamilyFriendly": "true",
    "mainEntityOfPage": {
        "@type": "WebPage",
        "@id": "{{ .Permalink }}"
    },
    "author" : {
        "@type": "Person",
        "name": "{{ $author }}"
    },
    "creator" : {
        "@type": "Person",
        "name": "{{ $author }}"
    },
    "accountablePerson" : {
        "@type": "Person",
        "name": "{{ $author }}"
    },
    "copyrightHolder" : "{{ $org_name }}",
    "copyrightYear" : "{{ .Date.Format "2006" }}",
    "dateCreated": "{{ .Date.Format "2006-01-02T15:04:05.00Z" | safeHTML }}",
    "datePublished": "{{ .PublishDate.Format "2006-01-02T15:04:05.00Z" | safeHTML }}",
    "dateModified": "{{ .Lastmod.Format "2006-01-02T15:04:05.00Z" | safeHTML }}",
    "publisher":{
        "@type":"Organization",
        "name": {{ $org_name }},
        "url": {{ .Site.BaseURL }},
        "logo": {
            "@type": "ImageObject",
            "url": "{{ .Site.Params.logo | absURL }}",
            "width":"32",
            "height":"32"
        }
    },
    "image": {{ if .Params.images }}[{{ range $i, $e := .Params.images }}{{ if $i }}, {{ end }}{{ $e | absURL }}{{ end }}]{{ else}}{{.Site.Params.logo | absURL }}{{ end }},
    "url" : "{{ .Permalink }}",
    "wordCount" : "{{ .WordCount }}",
    "genre" : [ {{ range $index, $tag := .Params.tags }}{{ if $index }}, {{ end }}"{{ $tag }}" {{ end }}],
    "keywords" : [ {{ range $index, $tag := .Params.tags }}{{ if $index }}, {{ end }}"{{ $tag }}" {{ end }}]
}
</script>
{{ end }}

</head>

================
File: layouts/partials/header.html
================
<header>
<p style="padding: 0;margin: 0;"><a href="/"><b>Interesting Reads</b></a></p>
<ul style="padding: 0;margin: 0;">
  <li><a href="/about">About</a></li> 
</ul>
</header>
<hr class="hr-list" style="padding: 0;margin: 0;">

================
File: layouts/partials/tags.html
================
{{ range $i, $e := .Params.tags -}}
    {{- if $i -}}, {{ end -}}
    <a href='{{ "/tags/" | relLangURL }}{{ . | urlize }}'>{{ $e | humanize }}</a>
{{- end -}}

================
File: layouts/shortcodes/tagcloud.html
================
{{ $tags := $.Site.Taxonomies.tags.ByCount }}
{{ $v1 := where $tags "Count" ">=" 3 }}
{{ $v2 := where $v1 "Term" "not in" (slice "hugo" "tags" "rss") }}
{{ range $v2 }}
{{ if .Term }}
{{ $tagURL := printf "tags/%s" .Term | relURL }}
<a href="{{ $tagURL }}">{{ .Term }} <span>({{ .Count }})</span></a>
{{ end }}
{{ end }}

================
File: layouts/taxonomy/category.html
================
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
  {{ partial "head.html" . }}
<body>
  <main>
    {{ partial "header.html" . }}
    <section>


      <ul class="posts">
  {{ range .Data.Pages }}
    <li>
      <a href="{{.RelPermalink}}">{{ .Title }} </a>
     
      {{ partial "categories.html" .}}
      <time datetime="{{ dateFormat "2006-01-02" .Date }}">{{ dateFormat "2006-01-02" .Date }}</time>
    </li>
  {{ end }}
</ul>



    </section>
    {{ partial "footer.html" . }}
  </main>
</body>
</html>

================

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
  {{ partial "head.html" . }}
<body>
  <main>
    {{ partial "header.html" . }}
    <section>


      <ul class="posts">
  {{ range .Data.Pages }}
    <li>
      <a href="{{.RelPermalink}}">{{ .Title }} </a>
      <time datetime="{{ dateFormat "2006-01-02" .Date }}">{{ dateFormat "02/01/06" .Date }}</time>
    </li>
  {{ end }}
</ul>



    </section>
    {{ partial "footer.html" . }}
  </main>
</body>
</html>

<main id="main">

  <div class="content">

    {{ partial "header.html" . }}

    <!-- post -->
    

      <p>The page you requested doesn't exist.</p>

    
    <!-- / post -->
<!--{{ partial "footer.html" . }}-->
  </div>
</main>
</body>
</html>

================
File: layouts/index.json
================
{
  "version": "https://jsonfeed.org/version/1",
  "title": "{{ .Site.Title }}",
  "home_page_url": "{{ .Site.BaseURL }}",
  "feed_url": "https://ronaldsvilcins.com/feed.json",
  "description": "{{ .Site.Params.description }}",
  "icon": "https://ronaldsvilcins.com/assets/apple-touch-icon.png",
  "favicon": "https://ronaldsvilcins.com/assets/favicon.ico",
  "expired": false,
  "author": {
    "name": "Ronalds Vilcins",
    "url": "https://ronaldsvilcins.com/"
  },
  "items": [
    {{ $list := (where .Site.RegularPages "Section" "posts") }}
    {{ $len := (len $list) }}

    {{ range $index, $element := $list }}
    {
      "id": {{ sha1 .Title | jsonify }},
      "title": {{ .Title | jsonify }},
      "summary": {{ .Description | jsonify }},
      "content_text": {{ .Content | plainify | jsonify }},
      "content_html": {{ .Content | jsonify }},
      "url": {{ .Permalink | jsonify }},
      "image": "{{ .Site.BaseURL }}photos/{{ .Params.photo }}",
      "banner_image": "{{ .Site.BaseURL }}photos/{{ .Params.photo }}",
      "date_published": "{{ .Date.Format `2016-02-09T14:22:00-07:00` | safeHTML }}",
      "date_modified": "{{ .Date.Format `2016-02-09T14:22:00-07:00` | safeHTML }}",
      "author": {
        "name": "Ronalds Vilcins",
        "url": "https://ronaldsvilcins.com/"
      }
    }{{ if ne (add $index 1) $len }},{{ end }}
    {{ end }}
  ]
}

================
File: layouts/index.xml
================
<rss version="2.0" xmlns:atom="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom">
  <channel>
    <!-- Required channel elements -->
    <title>{{ .Site.Title }}</title>
    <description>{{ .Site.Params.description }}</description>
    <link>{{ .Site.BaseURL }}</link>
    <!-- Optional channel elements -->
    <language>en</language>
    <copyright>Copyright {{ now.Format "2006"}}, Ronalds Vilcins</copyright>
    <lastBuildDate>{{ .Date.Format "Mon, 02 Jan 2006 15:04:05 -0700" | safeHTML }}</lastBuildDate>
    <generator>Hugo - gohugo.io</generator>
    <docs>http://cyber.harvard.edu/rss/rss.html</docs>
    <atom:link href="https://ronaldsvilcins.com/atom.xml" rel="self" type="application/atom+xml"/>
    {{ range where .Site.RegularPages "Section" "posts" }}
    <item>
      <title>{{ .Title }}</title>
      <link>{{ .Permalink }}</link>
      <description>{{ .Content | html }}</description>
      <author>ronalds.vilcins@gmail.com (Ronalds Vilcins)</author>
      <guid>{{ .Permalink }}</guid>
      <pubDate>{{ .Date.Format "Mon, 02 Jan 2006 15:04:05 -0700" | safeHTML }}</pubDate>
    </item>
    {{ end }}
  </channel>
</rss>

================
File: layouts/sitemap.xml
================
{{ printf "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"utf-8\" standalone=\"yes\" ?>" | safeHTML }}
<urlset xmlns="http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9"
  xmlns:xhtml="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
  {{ range .Data.Pages }}
  <url>
    <loc>{{ .Permalink }}</loc>{{ if not .Lastmod.IsZero }}
    <lastmod>{{ safeHTML ( .Lastmod.Format "2006-01-02T15:04:05-07:00" ) }}</lastmod>{{ end }}{{ with .Sitemap.ChangeFreq }}
    <changefreq>{{ . }}</changefreq>{{ end }}{{ if ge .Sitemap.Priority 0.0 }}
    <priority>{{ .Sitemap.Priority }}</priority>{{ end }}{{ if .IsTranslated }}{{ range .Translations }}
    <xhtml:link
                rel="alternate"
                hreflang="{{ .Lang }}"
                href="{{ .Permalink }}"
                />{{ end }}
    <xhtml:link
                rel="alternate"
                hreflang="{{ .Lang }}"
                href="{{ .Permalink }}"
                />{{ end }}
  </url>
  {{ end }}
</urlset>

File: public/1983/01/03/gandhi/index.html
================
<!doctype html><html lang=en><head><script src="/interestingreads/livereload.js?mindelay=10&amp;v=2&amp;port=1313&amp;path=interestingreads/livereload" data-no-instant defer></script><meta charset=utf-8><meta http-equiv=X-UA-Compatible content="IE=edge"><meta name=viewport content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"><meta name=author content="Liste - http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/"><title>The Gandhi Nobody Knows | Interesting Reads</title>
<meta name=description content="**Richard Grenier** – A critical look at the indian propaganda film 'Gandhi, exposing its historical inaccuracies and portrayal of a sanitized hero. A dicussion of Gandhi's complex life and controversial views on race, caste, and his early allegiance to the British Empire."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/1983/01/03/gandhi/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="The Gandhi Nobody Knows"><meta property="og:description" content="**Richard Grenier** – A critical look at the indian propaganda film 'Gandhi, exposing its historical inaccuracies and portrayal of a sanitized hero. <!doctype html><html lang=en><head><script src="/interestingreads/livereload.js?mindelay=10&amp;v=2&amp;port=1313&amp;path=interestingreads/livereload" data-no-instant defer></script><meta charset=utf-8><meta http-equiv=X-UA-Compatible content="IE=edge"><meta name=viewport content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"><meta name=author content="Liste - http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/"><title>Two Arms and a Head | Interesting Reads</title>
<meta name=description content="**Clayton Atreus** – An unflinching account of the existential horror of paraplegia – both a memoir and a suicide note. About the realities of paralysis, the false optimism of disability culture, and the moral failure of a world that denies people the right to die on their own terms."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/2008/03/11/2arms/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="Two Arms and a Head"><meta property="og:description" content="**Clayton Atreus** – An unflinching account of the existential horror of paraplegia – both a memoir and a suicide note. <meta name=description content="**The Last Psychiatrist** – Dissects sex addiction not as indulgence but as an unrelenting dialectic of desire and disgust, repetition compulsion masquerading as novelty-seeking. The pathology isn’t just in the sex but in the failed attempt at intimacy."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/2012/03/12/shame/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="Shame"><meta property="og:description" content="**The Last Psychiatrist** – Dissects sex addiction not as indulgence but as an unrelenting dialectic of desire and disgust, repetition compulsion masquerading as novelty-seeking. File: public/2013/03/13/sam/index.html

<meta name=description content="**Mencius Moldbug** – Major parts of American cities that were thriving in 1950 have now fallen into chaos and ruin. Meanwhile, Palo Alto is full of beautiful young people adoring every detail of their new Retina iPads. Which of these phenomena is more relevant?"><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/2013/03/13/sam/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="Sam Altman is not a blithering idiot"><meta property="og:description" content="**Mencius Moldbug** – Major parts of American cities that were thriving in 1950 have now fallen into chaos and ruin. <!doctype html><html lang=en><head><script src="/interestingreads/livereload.js?mindelay=10&amp;v=2&amp;port=1313&amp;path=interestingreads/livereload" data-no-instant defer></script><meta charset=utf-8><meta http-equiv=X-UA-Compatible content="IE=edge"><meta name=viewport content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"><meta name=author content="Liste - http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/"><title>What Is Ritual | Interesting Reads</title>
<meta name=description content="**Sarah Perry** – Ritual is everywhere, quietly shaping human life—even yours. What seems irrational—painful ceremonies, costly sacrifices, taboo behaviors—is actually vital social glue. This exploration reveals why rituals bind us and why modern life remains deeply ritualistic."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/2015/04/26/ritual/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="What Is Ritual"><meta property="og:description" content="**Sarah Perry** – Ritual is everywhere, quietly shaping human life—even yours. <meta name=description content="**Bruce Gilley** – Colonial governance often delivered stability, infrastructure, and economic progress—precisely what vanished after independence. It’s time to reconsider whether colonial-style interventions, done consensually, could help rebuild failing states today."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/2018/03/06/colonialism/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="The Case for Colonialism"><meta property="og:description" content="**Bruce Gilley** – Colonial governance often delivered stability, infrastructure, and economic progress—precisely what vanished after independence. File: public/2018/03/11/quantum/index.html
================
<!doctype html><html lang=en><head><script src="/interestingreads/livereload.js?mindelay=10&amp;v=2&amp;port=1313&amp;path=interestingreads/livereload" data-no-instant defer></script><meta charset=utf-8><meta http-equiv=X-UA-Compatible content="IE=edge"><meta name=viewport content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"><meta name=author content="Liste - http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/"><title>The Case Against Quantum Computing | Interesting Reads</title>
<meta name=description content="**Mikhail Dyakonov** – The proposed strategy for building a quantum computer relies on manipulating with high precision an unimaginably huge number of variables. That's very doubtful to succeed."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/2018/03/11/quantum/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="The Case Against Quantum Computing"><meta property="og:description" content="**Mikhail Dyakonov** – The proposed strategy for building a quantum computer relies on manipulating with high precision an unimaginably huge number of variables. That's very doubtful to succeed."><meta property="og:locale" content="en_us"><meta property="og:type" content="article"><meta property="article:section" content="posts"><meta property="article:published_time" content="2025-03-19T13:14:44+01:00"><meta property="article:modified_time" content="2018-03-11T00:00:00+00:00"><meta itemprop=name content="The Case Against Quantum Computing"><meta itemprop=description content="**Mikhail Dyakonov** – The proposed strategy for building a quantum computer relies on manipulating with high precision an unimaginably huge number of variables. That's very doubtful to succeed."><meta itemprop=datePublished content="2025-03-19T13:14:44+01:00"><meta itemprop=dateModified content="2018-03-11T00:00:00+00:00"><meta name=twitter:card content="summary"><meta name=twitter:title content="The Case Against Quantum Computing"><meta name=twitter:description content="**Mikhail Dyakonov** – The proposed strategy for building a quantum computer relies on manipulating with high precision an unimaginably huge number of variables. That's very doubtful to succeed."><link rel=canonical href=http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/2018/03/11/quantum/><meta name=monetization content="$twitter.xrptipbot.com/ronaldsvilcins"><link This paper examines historical inconsistencies, mathematical sleights of hand, and hidden assumptions that challenge its accuracy.","inLanguage":"en-us","isFamilyFriendly":"true","mainEntityOfPage":{"@type":"WebPage","@id":"http:\/\/localhost:1313\/interestingreads\/2021\/03\/10\/qed2\/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":""},"creator":{"@type":"Person","name":""},"accountablePerson":{"@type":"Person","name":""},"copyrightHolder":"Interesting Reads","copyrightYear":"2021","dateCreated":"2021-03-10T00:00:00.00Z","datePublished":"2025-03-19T12:04:40.00Z","dateModified":"2021-03-10T00:00:00.00Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Interesting Reads","url":"http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"http:\/\/localhost:1313\/resources\/_gen\/images\/library.svg","width":"32","height":"32"}},"image":"http://localhost:1313/resources/_gen/images/library.svg","url":"http:\/\/localhost:1313\/interestingreads\/2021\/03\/10\/qed2\/","wordCount":"0","genre":[],"keywords":[]}</script></head><body><a class=skip-link href=#main>Skip to main</a><main id=main><div class=content><header><p style=padding:0;margin:0><a href=/><b>Interesting Reads</b></a></p><ul style=padding:0;margin:0><li><a href=/about>About</a></li></ul></header><hr class=hr-list style=padding:0;margin:0><h2 class=post>Something is wrong in the state of QED</h2></div></main></body></html>

<meta name=description content="**Peter Robinson** – Long Covid illustrates how illness, culture, and psychology interact. A neurologist reflects on Havana Syndrome, Long Covid, TikTok Tourette’s, and the rise of functional neurological disorders. As media spreads awareness, it also shapes illness, blurring the line between pathology and perception."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/2022/03/11/longcovids/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="What 'Long Covid' Means"><meta property="og:description" content="**Peter Robinson** – Long Covid illustrates how illness, culture, and psychology interact. reversed class=list><li><a class=link href=https://archive.is/eOf92 title="The Gandhi Nobody Knows" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Gandhi Nobody Knows</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=1983-01-03>1983</time></li><p class=description><strong>Richard Grenier</strong> – A critical look at the indian propaganda film &lsquo;Gandhi, exposing its historical inaccuracies and portrayal of a sanitized hero. A dicussion of Gandhi&rsquo;s complex life and controversial views on race, caste, and his early allegiance to the British …</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.ribbonfarm.com/2015/02/11/what-is-ritual/ title="What Is Ritual" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">What Is Ritual</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2015-04-26>2015</time></li><p class=description><strong>Sarah Perry</strong> – Ritual is everywhere, quietly shaping human life—even yours. What seems irrational—painful ceremonies, costly sacrifices, taboo behaviors—is actually vital social glue. This exploration reveals why rituals bind us and why modern life remains deeply ritualistic.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.nas.org/academic-questions/31/2/the_case_for_colonialism title="The Case for Colonialism" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Case for Colonialism</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2018-03-06>2018</time></li><p class=description><strong>Bruce Gilley</strong> – Colonial governance often delivered stability, infrastructure, and economic progress—precisely what vanished after independence. It’s time to reconsider whether colonial-style interventions, done consensually, could help rebuild failing states today.</p><li><a class=link href=https://americanaffairsjournal.org/2021/08/the-value-of-nothing-capital-versus-growth/ title="The Value of Nothing Capital versus Growth" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Value of Nothing Capital versus Growth</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2021-03-08>2021</time></li><p class=description><strong>Julius Krein</strong> – Today’s economy prioritizes financial valuations over real growth, driving U.S. firms to chase short-term asset returns through financial engineering, outsourcing, and disinvestment.</p></ul></section></div></main></body></html>

ui,arial,sans-serif;text-rendering:optimizeLegibility;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;-moz-osx-font-smoothing:grayscale;padding:1rem;color:#000}.skip-link{position:absolute;top:-40px;left:0;background:#eee;z-index:100}.skip-link:focus{top:0}h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,strong,b{font-size:inherit;font-weight:600}header{padding-bottom:0}.link{overflow:hidden;text-overflow:ellipsis;white-space:normal;text-decoration:none;padding-top:.2rem}.time{font-variant-numeric:tabular-nums;white-space:nowrap}blockquote{border-left:5px solid #eee;padding-left:1rem;margin:0}a,a:visited{color:inherit}a:hover,a.heading-link{text-decoration:none}pre{padding:.5rem;overflow:auto;overflow-x:scroll;overflow-wrap:normal}code,pre{font-family:San Francisco Mono,Monaco,consolas,lucida console,dejavu sans mono,bitstream vera sans mono,monospace;font-size:normal;font-size:small;background:#eee}code{padding:.1rem;border:none}ul{list-style-type:square}ul,ol{padding-left:1.2rem}.list{line-height:2;list-style-type:none;padding-left:0}.list li{padding-bottom:0;display:flex;align-items:baseline}.meta{color:#777}.content{max-width:70ch;margin:0 auto}header{line-height:2;display:flex;justify-content:space-between;padding-bottom:1rem}header a{text-decoration:none}header ul{list-style-type:none;padding:0}header li,header a{display:inline}h2.post{padding-top:.5rem}header ul a:first-child{padding-left:1rem}.nav{height:1px;background:#000;content:'';max-width:10%}.list li time{flex:initial}.hr-list{margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;margin-right:.5rem;margin-left:.5rem;height:1px;border:0;border-bottom:1px dotted #ccc;flex:1 0 1rem}.m,hr{border:0;margin:3rem 0}img{max-width:100%;height:auto}@media screen and (max-width:600px){.content{padding:1rem}.list li{padding-bottom:0 rem}.link{font-size:1rem;line-height:1.4}.description{font-size:.85rem;margin:.3rem 0}.author{font-size:.8rem;margin:.3rem 0}.time{font-size:.8rem}.hr-list{margin:.5rem 0}}</style></head><body><a class=skip-link href=#main>Skip to main</a><main id=main><div class=content><header><p style=padding:0;margin:0><a href=/><b>Interesting Reads</b></a></p><ul style=padding:0;margin:0><li><a href=/about>About</a></li></ul></header><hr class=hr-list style=padding:0;margin:0><section><ul reversed class=list><li><a class=link href=https://svenschnieders.com/ title="Who shoves whom around inside the careenium?" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Who shoves whom around inside the careenium?</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=1982-03-11>1982</time></li><p class=description><strong>Douglas Hofstadter</strong> – a playful yet profound dialogue that explores the nature of selfhood, consciousness, and free will through the metaphor of the “careenium”—a chaotic yet self-organizing system of interacting elements. It asks: What is the meaning of the word &lsquo;I&rsquo;?</p><li><a class=link href=https://spectrum.ieee.org/the-case-against-quantum-computing title="The Case Against Quantum Computing" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Case Against Quantum Computing</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2018-03-11>2018</time></li><p class=description><strong>Mikhail Dyakonov</strong> – The proposed strategy for building a quantum computer relies on manipulating with high precision an unimaginably huge number of variables. That&rsquo;s very doubtful to succeed.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.sciphijournal.org/index.php/2017/11/12/why-the-culture-wins-an-appreciation-of-iain-m-banks/ title="Why the Culture Wins" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Why the Culture Wins</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2017-11-12>2017</time></li><p class=description><strong>Joseph Heath</strong> – A discussion of Iain M. Banks’ Culture series that imagines a post-scarcity utopia where technology liberates humanity from functional constraints, leaving culture as the dominant evolutionary force.</p><li><a class=link href=https://svenschnieders.com/ title="Something is wrong in the state of QED" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Something is wrong in the state of QED</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2021-03-10>2021</time></li><p class=description><strong>Oliver Consa</strong> – Quantum electrodynamics is considered the most precise theory in physics, yet its foundations rest on a single experimental value. This paper examines historical inconsistencies, mathematical sleights of hand, and hidden assumptions that challenge its accuracy.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.unqualified-reservations.org/2013/03/sam-altman-is-not-blithering-idiot/ title="Sam Altman is not a blithering idiot" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Sam Altman is not a blithering idiot</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2013-03-13>2013</time></li><p class=description><strong>Mencius Moldbug</strong> – Major parts of American cities that were thriving in 1950 have now fallen into chaos and ruin. Meanwhile, Palo Alto is full of beautiful young people adoring every detail of their new Retina iPads. Which of these phenomena is more relevant?</p><li><a class=link href=https://carcinisation.com/2020/01/27/ignorance-a-skilled-practice/ title="Ignorance, a skilled practice" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Ignorance, a skilled practice</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2020-01-27>2020</time></li><p class=description><strong>Science Banana</strong> – Exposes the global knowledge game as a fraud sustained by reified abstractions and bad metaphors. Ethnomethodology reveals meaning as irreducibly context-bound, leaving only tacit knowledge and linguistic quicksand.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.2arms1head.com/ title="Two Arms and a Head" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Two Arms and a Head</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2008-03-11>2008</time></li><p class=description><strong>Clayton Atreus</strong> – An unflinching account of the existential horror of paraplegia – both a memoir and a suicide note. About the realities of paralysis, the false optimism of disability culture, and the moral failure of a world that denies people the right to die on their own terms.</p><li><a class=link href=https://thelastpsychiatrist.com/2012/03/shame.html title=Shame target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Shame</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2012-03-12>2012</time></li><p class=description><strong>The Last Psychiatrist</strong> – Dissects sex addiction not as indulgence but as an unrelenting dialectic of desire and disgust, repetition compulsion masquerading as novelty-seeking. The pathology isn’t just in the sex but in the failed attempt at intimacy.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.theamericanconservative.com/what-long-covid-means/ title="What 'Long Covid' Means" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">What 'Long Covid' Means</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2022-03-11>2022</time></li><p class=description><strong>Peter Robinson</strong> – Long Covid illustrates how illness, culture, and psychology interact. A neurologist reflects on Havana Syndrome, Long Covid, TikTok Tourette’s, and the rise of functional neurological disorders. As media spreads awareness, it also shapes illness, blurring the …</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.lewissociety.org/innerring/ title="The Inner Ring" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Inner Ring</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=1944-03-11>1944</time></li><p class=description><strong>C. S. Lewis</strong> – We all secretly crave acceptance into the hidden circles quietly shaping our lives. Yet pursuing this invisible status often corrupts us, leaving only dissatisfaction. Genuine belonging, free from the endless chase for approval, is found elsewhere.</p></ul></section></div></main></body></html>

================

================

web.","thumbnailUrl":"http:\/\/localhost:1313\/resources\/_gen\/images\/library.svg","license":""}</script></head><body><a class=skip-link href=#main>Skip to main</a><main id=main><div class=content><header><p style=padding:0;margin:0><a href=/><b>Interesting Reads</b></a></p><ul style=padding:0;margin:0><li><a href=/about>About</a></li></ul></header><hr class=hr-list style=padding:0;margin:0><section><ul reversed class=list><li><a class=link href=https://archive.is/eOf92 title="The Gandhi Nobody Knows" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Gandhi Nobody Knows</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=1983-01-03>1983</time></li><p class=description><strong>Richard Grenier</strong> – A critical look at the indian propaganda film &lsquo;Gandhi, exposing its historical inaccuracies and portrayal of a sanitized hero. A dicussion of Gandhi&rsquo;s complex life and controversial views on race, caste, and his early allegiance to the British …</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.ribbonfarm.com/2015/02/11/what-is-ritual/ title="What Is Ritual" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">What Is Ritual</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2015-04-26>2015</time></li><p class=description><strong>Sarah Perry</strong> – Ritual is everywhere, quietly shaping human life—even yours. What seems irrational—painful ceremonies, costly sacrifices, taboo behaviors—is actually vital social glue. This exploration reveals why rituals bind us and why modern life remains deeply ritualistic.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.nas.org/academic-questions/31/2/the_case_for_colonialism title="The Case for Colonialism" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Case for Colonialism</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2018-03-06>2018</time></li><p class=description><strong>Bruce Gilley</strong> – Colonial governance often delivered stability, infrastructure, and economic progress—precisely what vanished after independence. It’s time to reconsider whether colonial-style interventions, done consensually, could help rebuild failing states today.</p><li><a class=link href=https://americanaffairsjournal.org/2021/08/the-value-of-nothing-capital-versus-growth/ title="The Value of Nothing Capital versus Growth" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Value of Nothing Capital versus Growth</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2021-03-08>2021</time></li><p class=description><strong>Julius Krein</strong> – Today’s economy prioritizes financial valuations over real growth, driving U.S. firms to chase short-term asset returns through financial engineering, outsourcing, and disinvestment.</p></ul></section></div></main></body></html>

  <style>*,:after,:before{box-sizing:border-box;padding:0}.description{font-size:.9rem;color:#777;margin:0;line-height:1.5}body{font:1rem/1.5 '-apple-system',BlinkMacSystemFont,avenir next,avenir,helvetica,helvetica neue,ubuntu,roboto,noto,segoe ui,arial,sans-serif;text-rendering:optimizeLegibility;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;-moz-osx-font-smoothing:grayscale;padding:1rem;color:#000}.skip-link{position:absolute;top:-40px;left:0;background:#eee;z-index:100}.skip-link:focus{top:0}h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,strong,b{font-size:inherit;font-weight:600}header{padding-bottom:0}.link{overflow:hidden;text-overflow:ellipsis;white-space:normal;text-decoration:none;padding-top:.2rem}.time{font-variant-numeric:tabular-nums;white-space:nowrap}blockquote{border-left:5px solid #eee;padding-left:1rem;margin:0}a,a:visited{color:inherit}a:hover,a.heading-link{text-decoration:none}pre{padding:.5rem;overflow:auto;overflow-x:scroll;overflow-wrap:normal}code,pre{font-family:San Francisco Mono,Monaco,consolas,lucida console,dejavu sans mono,bitstream vera sans mono,monospace;font-size:normal;font-size:small;background:#eee}code{padding:.1rem;border:none}ul{list-style-type:square}ul,ol{padding-left:1.2rem}.list{line-height:2;list-style-type:none;padding-left:0}.list li{padding-bottom:0;display:flex;align-items:baseline}.meta{color:#777}.content{max-width:70ch;margin:0 auto}header{line-height:2;display:flex;justify-content:space-between;padding-bottom:1rem}header a{text-decoration:none}header ul{list-style-type:none;padding:0}header li,header a{display:inline}h2.post{padding-top:.5rem}header ul a:first-child{padding-left:1rem}.nav{height:1px;background:#000;content:'';max-width:10%}.list li time{flex:initial}.hr-list{margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;margin-right:.5rem;margin-left:.5rem;height:1px;border:0;border-bottom:1px dotted #ccc;flex:1 0 1rem}.m,hr{border:0;margin:3rem 0}img{max-width:100%;height:auto}@media screen and (max-width:600px){.content{padding:1rem}.list li{padding-bottom:0 rem}.link{font-size:1rem;line-height:1.4}.description{font-size:.85rem;margin:.3rem 0}.author{font-size:.8rem;margin:.3rem 0}.time{font-size:.8rem}.hr-list{margin:.5rem 0}}</style>

  

</head>
<body>
  <a class="skip-link" href="#main">Skip to main</a>
  <main id="main">
  <div class="content">
    <header>
<p style="padding: 0;margin: 0;"><a href="/"><b>Listed</b></a></p>
<ul style="padding: 0;margin: 0;">
  <li><a href="/about">About</a></li> 
</ul>
</header>
<hr class="hr-list" style="padding: 0;margin: 0;">
    <section>
      <ul reversed class="list">
        
          
          <li>
            <a class="link" href="https://svenschnieders.com/" title="Markdown Syntax Guide">Markdown Syntax Guide</a>
            <hr class="hr-list">
            <time class="g time" datetime="2005-03-11">2005</time>
          </li>
          <p class="description">Sven Schnieders - When Boris entered the room, Prince Andrey was listening to an old general, wearing his decorations, who was reporting something to Prince Andrey, with an expression of soldierly servility on his purple face. “Alright. Please wait!” When Boris (h/t AllenSan)</p>
          
        
          
          <li>
            <a class="link" href="https://www.lewissociety.org/innerring/" title="The Inner Ring">The Inner Ring</a>
            <hr class="hr-list">
            <time class="g time" datetime="1944-03-11">1944</time>
          </li>
          <p class="description">C. S. Lewis – We all secretly crave acceptance into the hidden circles quietly shaping our lives. Yet pursuing this invisible status often corrupts us, leaving only dissatisfaction. Genuine belonging, free from the endless chase for approval, is found elsewhere.</p>
          
        
      </ul>
    </section>
  </div>
</main>
</body>
</html>

File: public/posts/colonialism/index.html

It’s time to reconsider whether colonial-style interventions, done consensually, could help rebuild failing states today."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/posts/colonialism/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="The Case for Colonialism"><meta property="og:description" content="**Bruce Gilley** – Colonial governance often delivered stability, infrastructure, and economic progress—precisely what vanished after independence. It’s time to reconsider whether colonial-style interventions, done consensually, could help rebuild failing states today.","inLanguage":"en-us","isFamilyFriendly":"true","mainEntityOfPage":{"@type":"WebPage","@id":"http:\/\/localhost:1313\/interestingreads\/posts\/colonialism\/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":""},"creator":{"@type":"Person","name":""},"accountablePerson":{"@type":"Person","name":""},"copyrightHolder":"Interesting Reads","copyrightYear":"2018","dateCreated":"2018-03-06T00:00:00.00Z","datePublished":"2025-03-19T11:25:13.00Z","dateModified":"2018-03-06T00:00:00.00Z","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Interesting Reads","url":"http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"http:\/\/localhost:1313\/interestingreads\/","width":"32","height":"32"}},"image":"http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/","url":"http:\/\/localhost:1313\/interestingreads\/posts\/colonialism\/","wordCount":"0","genre":[],"keywords":[]}</script></head><body><a class=skip-link href=#main>Skip to main</a><main id=main><div class=content><header><p style=padding:0;margin:0><a href=/><b>Interesting Reads</b></a></p><ul style=padding:0;margin:0><li><a href=/about>About</a></li></ul></header><hr class=hr-list style=padding:0;margin:0><h2 class=post>The Case for Colonialism</h2></div></main></body></html>

<meta name=description content="**Richard Grenier** – A critical look at the indian propaganda film 'Gandhi, exposing its historical inaccuracies and portrayal of a sanitized hero. A dicussion of Gandhi's complex life and controversial views on race, caste, and his early allegiance to the British Empire."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/posts/gandhi/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="The Gandhi Nobody Knows"><meta property="og:description" content="**Richard Grenier** – A critical look at the indian propaganda film 'Gandhi, exposing its historical inaccuracies and portrayal of a sanitized hero. File: public/posts/ignorance/index.html
================
<!doctype html><html lang=en><head><script src="/interestingreads/livereload.js?mindelay=10&amp;v=2&amp;port=1313&amp;path=interestingreads/livereload" data-no-instant defer></script><meta charset=utf-8><meta http-equiv=X-UA-Compatible content="IE=edge"><meta name=viewport content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"><meta name=author content="Liste - http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/"><title>Ignorance, a skilled practice | Interesting Reads</title>
<meta name=description content="**Science Banana** – Exposes the global knowledge game as a fraud sustained by reified abstractions and bad metaphors. Ethnomethodology reveals meaning as irreducibly context-bound, leaving only tacit knowledge and linguistic quicksand."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/posts/ignorance/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="Ignorance, a skilled practice"><meta property="og:description" content="**Science Banana** – Exposes the global knowledge game as a fraud sustained by reified abstractions and bad metaphors. Ethnomethodology reveals meaning as irreducibly context-bound, leaving only tacit knowledge and linguistic quicksand."><meta property="og:locale" content="en_us"><meta property="og:type" content="article"><meta property="article:section" content="posts"><meta property="article:published_time" content="2025-03-19T11:52:59+01:00"><meta property="article:modified_time" content="2020-01-27T00:00:00+00:00"><meta itemprop=name content="Ignorance, a skilled practice"><meta itemprop=description content="**Science Banana** – Exposes the global knowledge game as a fraud sustained by reified abstractions and bad metaphors. <!doctype html><html lang=en><head><script src="/interestingreads/livereload.js?mindelay=10&amp;v=2&amp;port=1313&amp;path=interestingreads/livereload" data-no-instant defer></script><meta charset=utf-8><meta http-equiv=X-UA-Compatible content="IE=edge"><meta name=viewport content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"><meta name=author content="Liste - http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/"><title>What 'Long Covid' Means | Interesting Reads</title>
<meta name=description content="**Peter Robinson** – Long Covid illustrates how illness, culture, and psychology interact. A neurologist reflects on Havana Syndrome, Long Covid, TikTok Tourette’s, and the rise of functional neurological disorders. As media spreads awareness, it also shapes illness, blurring the line between pathology and perception."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/posts/longcovids/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="What 'Long Covid' Means"><meta property="og:description" content="**Peter Robinson** – Long Covid illustrates how illness, culture, and psychology interact. As media spreads awareness, it also shapes illness, blurring the line between pathology and perception."><meta property="og:locale" content="en_us"><meta property="og:type" content="article"><meta property="article:section" content="posts"><meta property="article:published_time" content="2025-03-19T11:33:30+01:00"><meta property="article:modified_time" content="2022-03-11T00:00:00+00:00"><meta itemprop=name content="What 'Long Covid' Means"><meta itemprop=description content="**Peter Robinson** – Long Covid illustrates how illness, culture, and psychology interact. time{flex:initial}.hr-list{margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;margin-right:.5rem;margin-left:.5rem;height:1px;border:0;border-bottom:1px dotted #ccc;flex:1 0 1rem}.m,hr{border:0;margin:3rem 0}img{max-width:100%;height:auto}@media screen and (max-width:600px){.content{padding:1rem}.list li{padding-bottom:0 rem}.link{font-size:1rem;line-height:1.4}.description{font-size:.85rem;margin:.3rem 0}.author{font-size:.8rem;margin:.3rem 0}.time{font-size:.8rem}.hr-list{margin:.5rem 0}}</style>

reversed class=list><li><a class=link href=https://archive.is/eOf92 title="The Gandhi Nobody Knows" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Gandhi Nobody Knows</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=1983-01-03>1983</time></li><p class=description><strong>Richard Grenier</strong> – A critical look at the indian propaganda film &lsquo;Gandhi, exposing its historical inaccuracies and portrayal of a sanitized hero. A dicussion of Gandhi&rsquo;s complex life and controversial views on race, caste, and his early allegiance to the British …</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.ribbonfarm.com/2015/02/11/what-is-ritual/ title="What Is Ritual" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">What Is Ritual</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2015-04-26>2015</time></li><p class=description><strong>Sarah Perry</strong> – Ritual is everywhere, quietly shaping human life—even yours. What seems irrational—painful ceremonies, costly sacrifices, taboo behaviors—is actually vital social glue. This exploration reveals why rituals bind us and why modern life remains deeply ritualistic.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.nas.org/academic-questions/31/2/the_case_for_colonialism title="The Case for Colonialism" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Case for Colonialism</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2018-03-06>2018</time></li><p class=description><strong>Bruce Gilley</strong> – Colonial governance often delivered stability, infrastructure, and economic progress—precisely what vanished after independence. It’s time to reconsider whether colonial-style interventions, done consensually, could help rebuild failing states today.</p><li><a class=link href=https://americanaffairsjournal.org/2021/08/the-value-of-nothing-capital-versus-growth/ title="The Value of Nothing Capital versus Growth" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Value of Nothing Capital versus Growth</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2021-03-08>2021</time></li><p class=description><strong>Julius Krein</strong> – Today’s economy prioritizes financial valuations over real growth, driving U.S. firms to chase short-term asset returns through financial engineering, outsourcing, and disinvestment.</p></ul></section></div></main></body></html>

  <meta name="description" content="**Oliver Consa** – Quantum electrodynamics is considered the most precise theory in physics, yet its foundations rest on a single experimental value. This paper examines historical inconsistencies, mathematical sleights of hand, and hidden assumptions that challenge its accuracy.">

<meta name=description content="**Oliver Consa** – Quantum electrodynamics is considered the most precise theory in physics, yet its foundations rest on a single experimental value. This paper examines historical inconsistencies, mathematical sleights of hand, and hidden assumptions that challenge its accuracy."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/posts/qed2/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="Something is wrong in the state of QED"><meta property="og:description" content="**Oliver Consa** – Quantum electrodynamics is considered the most precise theory in physics, yet its foundations rest on a single experimental value. That's very doubtful to succeed."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/posts/quantum/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="The Case Against Quantum Computing"><meta property="og:description" content="**Mikhail Dyakonov** – The proposed strategy for building a quantum computer relies on manipulating with high precision an unimaginably huge number of variables. <meta name=description content="**C. S. Lewis** – We all secretly crave acceptance into the hidden circles quietly shaping our lives. Yet pursuing this invisible status often corrupts us, leaving only dissatisfaction. <!doctype html><html lang=en><head><script src="/interestingreads/livereload.js?mindelay=10&amp;v=2&amp;port=1313&amp;path=interestingreads/livereload" data-no-instant defer></script><meta charset=utf-8><meta http-equiv=X-UA-Compatible content="IE=edge"><meta name=viewport content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"><meta name=author content="Liste - http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/"><title>What Is Ritual | Interesting Reads</title>
<meta name=description content="**Sarah Perry** – Ritual is everywhere, quietly shaping human life—even yours. What seems irrational—painful ceremonies, costly sacrifices, taboo behaviors—is actually vital social glue. This exploration reveals why rituals bind us and why modern life remains deeply ritualistic."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/posts/ritual/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="What Is Ritual"><meta property="og:description" content="**Sarah Perry** – Ritual is everywhere, quietly shaping human life—even yours.   <meta name="description" content="C. S. Lewis – We all secretly crave acceptance into the hidden circles quietly shaping our lives. Yet pursuing this invisible status often corrupts us, leaving only dissatisfaction. Genuine belonging, free from the endless chase for approval, is found elsewhere.">

File: public/posts/shame/index.html

<!doctype html><html lang=en><head><script src="/interestingreads/livereload.js?mindelay=10&amp;v=2&amp;port=1313&amp;path=interestingreads/livereload" data-no-instant defer></script><meta charset=utf-8><meta http-equiv=X-UA-Compatible content="IE=edge"><meta name=viewport content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"><meta name=author content="Liste - http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/"><title>Shame | Interesting Reads</title>
<meta name=description content="**The Last Psychiatrist** – Dissects sex addiction not as indulgence but as an unrelenting dialectic of desire and disgust, repetition compulsion masquerading as novelty-seeking. The pathology isn’t just in the sex but in the failed attempt at intimacy."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/posts/shame/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="Shame"><meta property="og:description" content="**The Last Psychiatrist** – Dissects sex addiction not as indulgence but as an unrelenting dialectic of desire and disgust, repetition compulsion masquerading as novelty-seeking. <!doctype html><html lang=en><head><script src="/interestingreads/livereload.js?mindelay=10&amp;v=2&amp;port=1313&amp;path=interestingreads/livereload" data-no-instant defer></script><meta charset=utf-8><meta http-equiv=X-UA-Compatible content="IE=edge"><meta name=viewport content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"><meta name=author content="Liste - http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/"><title>Posts | Interesting Reads</title>
<meta name=description content="A curated collection of articles from around the web."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/posts/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="Posts"><meta property="og:description" content="A curated collection of articles from around the web."><meta property="og:locale" content="en_us"><meta property="og:type" content="website"><meta itemprop=name content="Posts"><meta itemprop=description content="A curated collection of articles from around the web."><meta itemprop=datePublished content="2025-03-19T15:51:18+01:00"><meta itemprop=dateModified content="2022-03-11T00:00:00+00:00"><meta name=twitter:card content="summary"><meta name=twitter:title content="Posts"><meta name=twitter:description content="A curated collection of articles from around the web."><link rel=canonical href=http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/posts/><meta name=monetization content="$twitter.xrptipbot.com/ronaldsvilcins"><link rel=dns-prefetch href=https://www.google-analytics.com><link href=https://www.google-analytics.com rel=preconnect crossorigin><link rel=alternate type=application/atom+xml title="Interesting Reads" href=http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/atom.xml><link rel=alternate type=application/json title="Interesting Reads" href=http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/feed.json><link rel="shortcut icon" type=image/svg+xml href=http://localhost:1313/resources/_gen/images/library.svg><style>*,:after,:before{box-sizing:border-box;padding:0}.description{font-size:.9rem;color:#777;margin:0;line-height:1.5}body{font:1rem/1.5 '-apple-system',BlinkMacSystemFont,avenir next,avenir,helvetica,helvetica neue,ubuntu,roboto,noto,segoe ui,arial,sans-serif;text-rendering:optimizeLegibility;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;-moz-osx-font-smoothing:grayscale;padding:1rem;color:#000}.skip-link{position:absolute;top:-40px;left:0;background:#eee;z-index:100}.skip-link:focus{top:0}h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,strong,b{font-size:inherit;font-weight:600}header{padding-bottom:0}.link{overflow:hidden;text-overflow:ellipsis;white-space:normal;text-decoration:none;padding-top:.2rem}.time{font-variant-numeric:tabular-nums;white-space:nowrap}blockquote{border-left:5px solid #eee;padding-left:1rem;margin:0}a,a:visited{color:inherit}a:hover,a.heading-link{text-decoration:none}pre{padding:.5rem;overflow:auto;overflow-x:scroll;overflow-wrap:normal}code,pre{font-family:San Francisco Mono,Monaco,consolas,lucida console,dejavu sans mono,bitstream vera sans mono,monospace;font-size:normal;font-size:small;background:#eee}code{padding:.1rem;border:none}ul{list-style-type:square}ul,ol{padding-left:1.2rem}.list{line-height:2;list-style-type:none;padding-left:0}.list li{padding-bottom:0;display:flex;align-items:baseline}.meta{color:#777}.content{max-width:70ch;margin:0 auto}header{line-height:2;display:flex;justify-content:space-between;padding-bottom:1rem}header a{text-decoration:none}header ul{list-style-type:none;padding:0}header li,header a{display:inline}h2.post{padding-top:.5rem}header ul a:first-child{padding-left:1rem}.nav{height:1px;background:#000;content:'';max-width:10%}.list li time{flex:initial}.hr-list{margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;margin-right:.5rem;margin-left:.5rem;height:1px;border:0;border-bottom:1px dotted #ccc;flex:1 0 1rem}.m,hr{border:0;margin:3rem 0}img{max-width:100%;height:auto}@media screen and (max-width:600px){.content{padding:1rem}.list li{padding-bottom:0 rem}.link{font-size:1rem;line-height:1.4}.description{font-size:.85rem;margin:.3rem 0}.author{font-size:.8rem;margin:.3rem 0}.time{font-size:.8rem}.hr-list{margin:.5rem 0}}</style></head><body><a class=skip-link href=#main>Skip to main</a><main id=main><div class=content><header><p style=padding:0;margin:0><a href=/><b>Interesting Reads</b></a></p><ul style=padding:0;margin:0><li><a href=/about>About</a></li></ul></header><hr class=hr-list style=padding:0;margin:0><section><ul reversed class=list><li><a class=link href=https://svenschnieders.com/ title="Who shoves whom around inside the careenium?" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Who shoves whom around inside the careenium?</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=1982-03-11>1982</time></li><p class=description><strong>Douglas Hofstadter</strong> – a playful yet profound dialogue that explores the nature of selfhood, consciousness, and free will through the metaphor of the “careenium”—a chaotic yet self-organizing system of interacting elements. It asks: What is the meaning of the word &lsquo;I&rsquo;?</p><li><a class=link href=https://spectrum.ieee.org/the-case-against-quantum-computing title="The Case Against Quantum Computing" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Case Against Quantum Computing</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2018-03-11>2018</time></li><p class=description><strong>Mikhail Dyakonov</strong> – The proposed strategy for building a quantum computer relies on manipulating with high precision an unimaginably huge number of variables. That&rsquo;s very doubtful to succeed.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.sciphijournal.org/index.php/2017/11/12/why-the-culture-wins-an-appreciation-of-iain-m-banks/ title="Why the Culture Wins" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Why the Culture Wins</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2017-11-12>2017</time></li><p class=description><strong>Joseph Heath</strong> – A discussion of Iain M. Banks’ Culture series that imagines a post-scarcity utopia where technology liberates humanity from functional constraints, leaving culture as the dominant evolutionary force.</p><li><a class=link href=https://svenschnieders.com/ title="Something is wrong in the state of QED" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Something is wrong in the state of QED</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2021-03-10>2021</time></li><p class=description><strong>Oliver Consa</strong> – Quantum electrodynamics is considered the most precise theory in physics, yet its foundations rest on a single experimental value. This paper examines historical inconsistencies, mathematical sleights of hand, and hidden assumptions that challenge its accuracy.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.unqualified-reservations.org/2013/03/sam-altman-is-not-blithering-idiot/ title="Sam Altman is not a blithering idiot" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Sam Altman is not a blithering idiot</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2013-03-13>2013</time></li><p class=description><strong>Mencius Moldbug</strong> – Major parts of American cities that were thriving in 1950 have now fallen into chaos and ruin. Meanwhile, Palo Alto is full of beautiful young people adoring every detail of their new Retina iPads. Which of these phenomena is more relevant?</p><li><a class=link href=https://carcinisation.com/2020/01/27/ignorance-a-skilled-practice/ title="Ignorance, a skilled practice" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Ignorance, a skilled practice</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2020-01-27>2020</time></li><p class=description><strong>Science Banana</strong> – Exposes the global knowledge game as a fraud sustained by reified abstractions and bad metaphors. Ethnomethodology reveals meaning as irreducibly context-bound, leaving only tacit knowledge and linguistic quicksand.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.2arms1head.com/ title="Two Arms and a Head" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Two Arms and a Head</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2008-03-11>2008</time></li><p class=description><strong>Clayton Atreus</strong> – An unflinching account of the existential horror of paraplegia – both a memoir and a suicide note. About the realities of paralysis, the false optimism of disability culture, and the moral failure of a world that denies people the right to die on their own terms.</p><li><a class=link href=https://thelastpsychiatrist.com/2012/03/shame.html title=Shame target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Shame</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2012-03-12>2012</time></li><p class=description><strong>The Last Psychiatrist</strong> – Dissects sex addiction not as indulgence but as an unrelenting dialectic of desire and disgust, repetition compulsion masquerading as novelty-seeking. The pathology isn’t just in the sex but in the failed attempt at intimacy.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.theamericanconservative.com/what-long-covid-means/ title="What 'Long Covid' Means" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">What 'Long Covid' Means</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2022-03-11>2022</time></li><p class=description><strong>Peter Robinson</strong> – Long Covid illustrates how illness, culture, and psychology interact. A neurologist reflects on Havana Syndrome, Long Covid, TikTok Tourette’s, and the rise of functional neurological disorders. As media spreads awareness, it also shapes illness, blurring the …</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.lewissociety.org/innerring/ title="The Inner Ring" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Inner Ring</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=1944-03-11>1944</time></li><p class=description><strong>C. S. Lewis</strong> – We all secretly crave acceptance into the hidden circles quietly shaping our lives. Yet pursuing this invisible status often corrupts us, leaving only dissatisfaction. Genuine belonging, free from the endless chase for approval, is found elsewhere.</p></ul></section></div></main></body></html>

File: public/posts/index.xml
================

<!doctype html><html lang=en><head><script src="/interestingreads/livereload.js?mindelay=10&amp;v=2&amp;port=1313&amp;path=interestingreads/livereload" data-no-instant defer></script><meta charset=utf-8><meta http-equiv=X-UA-Compatible content="IE=edge"><meta name=viewport content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"><meta name=author content="Liste - http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/"><title>Tags | Interesting Reads</title>
<meta name=description content="A curated collection of articles from around the web."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/tags/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="Tags"><meta property="og:description" content="A curated collection of articles from around the web."><meta property="og:locale" content="en_us"><meta property="og:type" content="website"><meta itemprop=name content="Tags"><meta itemprop=description content="A curated collection of articles from around the web."><meta href=http://localhost:1313/resources/_gen/images/library.svg><style>*,:after,:before{box-sizing:border-box;padding:0}.description{font-size:.9rem;color:#777;margin:0;line-height:1.5}body{font:1rem/1.5 '-apple-system',BlinkMacSystemFont,avenir next,avenir,helvetica,helvetica neue,ubuntu,roboto,noto,segoe ui,arial,sans-serif;text-rendering:optimizeLegibility;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;-moz-osx-font-smoothing:grayscale;padding:1rem;color:#000}.skip-link{position:absolute;top:-40px;left:0;background:#eee;z-index:100}.skip-link:focus{top:0}h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,strong,b{font-size:inherit;font-weight:600}header{padding-bottom:0}.link{overflow:hidden;text-overflow:ellipsis;white-space:normal;text-decoration:none;padding-top:.2rem}.time{font-variant-numeric:tabular-nums;white-space:nowrap}blockquote{border-left:5px solid #eee;padding-left:1rem;margin:0}a,a:visited{color:inherit}a:hover,a.heading-link{text-decoration:none}pre{padding:.5rem;overflow:auto;overflow-x:scroll;overflow-wrap:normal}code,pre{font-family:San Francisco Mono,Monaco,consolas,lucida console,dejavu sans mono,bitstream vera sans mono,monospace;font-size:normal;font-size:small;background:#eee}code{padding:.1rem;border:none}ul{list-style-type:square}ul,ol{padding-left:1.2rem}.list{line-height:2;list-style-type:none;padding-left:0}.list li{padding-bottom:0;display:flex;align-items:baseline}.meta{color:#777}.content{max-width:70ch;margin:0 auto}header{line-height:2;display:flex;justify-content:space-between;padding-bottom:1rem}header a{text-decoration:none}header ul{list-style-type:none;padding:0}header li,header a{display:inline}h2.post{padding-top:.5rem}header ul a:first-child{padding-left:1rem}.nav{height:1px;background:#000;content:'';max-width:10%}.list li time{flex:initial}.hr-list{margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;margin-right:.5rem;margin-left:.5rem;height:1px;border:0;border-bottom:1px dotted #ccc;flex:1 0 1rem}.m,hr{border:0;margin:3rem 0}img{max-width:100%;height:auto}@media screen and (max-width:600px){.content{padding:1rem}.list li{padding-bottom:0 rem}.link{font-size:1rem;line-height:1.4}.description{font-size:.85rem;margin:.3rem 0}.author{font-size:.8rem;margin:.3rem 0}.time{font-size:.8rem}.hr-list{margin:.5rem 0}}</style></head><body><a class=skip-link href=#main>Skip to main</a><main id=main><div class=content><header><p style=padding:0;margin:0><a href=/><b>Interesting Reads</b></a></p><ul style=padding:0;margin:0><li><a href=/about>About</a></li></ul></header><hr class=hr-list style=padding:0;margin:0><section><ul reversed class=list><li><a class=link href=https://archive.is/eOf92 title="The Gandhi Nobody Knows" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Gandhi Nobody Knows</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=1983-01-03>1983</time></li><p class=description><strong>Richard Grenier</strong> – A critical look at the indian propaganda film &lsquo;Gandhi, exposing its historical inaccuracies and portrayal of a sanitized hero. A dicussion of Gandhi&rsquo;s complex life and controversial views on race, caste, and his early allegiance to the British …</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.ribbonfarm.com/2015/02/11/what-is-ritual/ title="What Is Ritual" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">What Is Ritual</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2015-04-26>2015</time></li><p class=description><strong>Sarah Perry</strong> – Ritual is everywhere, quietly shaping human life—even yours. What seems irrational—painful ceremonies, costly sacrifices, taboo behaviors—is actually vital social glue. This exploration reveals why rituals bind us and why modern life remains deeply ritualistic.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.nas.org/academic-questions/31/2/the_case_for_colonialism title="The Case for Colonialism" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Case for Colonialism</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2018-03-06>2018</time></li><p class=description><strong>Bruce Gilley</strong> – Colonial governance often delivered stability, infrastructure, and economic progress—precisely what vanished after independence. It’s time to reconsider whether colonial-style interventions, done consensually, could help rebuild failing states today.</p><li><a class=link href=https://americanaffairsjournal.org/2021/08/the-value-of-nothing-capital-versus-growth/ title="The Value of Nothing Capital versus Growth" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Value of Nothing Capital versus Growth</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2021-03-08>2021</time></li><p class=description><strong>Julius Krein</strong> – Today’s economy prioritizes financial valuations over real growth, driving U.S. firms to chase short-term asset returns through financial engineering, outsourcing, and disinvestment.</p></ul></section></div></main></body></html>

================
File: public/tags/themes/index.html
================
