<!doctype html><html lang=en><head><script src="/interestingreads/livereload.js?mindelay=10&amp;v=2&amp;port=1313&amp;path=interestingreads/livereload" data-no-instant defer></script><meta charset=utf-8><meta http-equiv=X-UA-Compatible content="IE=edge"><meta name=viewport content="width=device-width,initial-scale=1"><meta name=author content="Liste - http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/"><title>Tags | Interesting Reads</title>
<meta name=description content="A curated collection of articles from around the web."><meta property="og:url" content="http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/tags/"><meta property="og:site_name" content="Interesting Reads"><meta property="og:title" content="Tags"><meta property="og:description" content="A curated collection of articles from around the web."><meta property="og:locale" content="en_us"><meta property="og:type" content="website"><meta itemprop=name content="Tags"><meta itemprop=description content="A curated collection of articles from around the web."><meta name=twitter:card content="summary"><meta name=twitter:title content="Tags"><meta name=twitter:description content="A curated collection of articles from around the web."><link rel=canonical href=http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/tags/><meta name=monetization content="$twitter.xrptipbot.com/ronaldsvilcins"><link rel=dns-prefetch href=https://www.google-analytics.com><link href=https://www.google-analytics.com rel=preconnect crossorigin><link rel=alternate type=application/atom+xml title="Interesting Reads" href=http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/atom.xml><link rel=alternate type=application/json title="Interesting Reads" href=http://localhost:1313/interestingreads/feed.json><link rel="shortcut icon" type=image/svg+xml href=http://localhost:1313/resources/_gen/images/library.svg><style>*,:after,:before{box-sizing:border-box;padding:0}.description{font-size:.9rem;color:#777;margin:0;line-height:1.5}body{font:1rem/1.5 '-apple-system',BlinkMacSystemFont,avenir next,avenir,helvetica,helvetica neue,ubuntu,roboto,noto,segoe ui,arial,sans-serif;text-rendering:optimizeLegibility;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;-moz-osx-font-smoothing:grayscale;padding:1rem;color:#000}.skip-link{position:absolute;top:-40px;left:0;background:#eee;z-index:100}.skip-link:focus{top:0}h1,h2,h3,h4,h5,strong,b{font-size:inherit;font-weight:600}header{padding-bottom:0}.link{overflow:hidden;text-overflow:ellipsis;white-space:normal;text-decoration:none;padding-top:.2rem}.time{font-variant-numeric:tabular-nums;white-space:nowrap}blockquote{border-left:5px solid #eee;padding-left:1rem;margin:0}a,a:visited{color:inherit}a:hover,a.heading-link{text-decoration:none}pre{padding:.5rem;overflow:auto;overflow-x:scroll;overflow-wrap:normal}code,pre{font-family:San Francisco Mono,Monaco,consolas,lucida console,dejavu sans mono,bitstream vera sans mono,monospace;font-size:normal;font-size:small;background:#eee}code{padding:.1rem;border:none}ul{list-style-type:square}ul,ol{padding-left:1.2rem}.list{line-height:2;list-style-type:none;padding-left:0}.list li{padding-bottom:0;display:flex;align-items:baseline}.meta{color:#777}.content{max-width:70ch;margin:0 auto}header{line-height:2;display:flex;justify-content:space-between;padding-bottom:1rem}header a{text-decoration:none}header ul{list-style-type:none;padding:0}header li,header a{display:inline}h2.post{padding-top:.5rem}header ul a:first-child{padding-left:1rem}.nav{height:1px;background:#000;content:'';max-width:10%}.list li time{flex:initial}.hr-list{margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;margin-right:.5rem;margin-left:.5rem;height:1px;border:0;border-bottom:1px dotted #ccc;flex:1 0 1rem}.m,hr{border:0;margin:3rem 0}img{max-width:100%;height:auto}@media screen and (max-width:600px){.content{padding:1rem}.list li{padding-bottom:0 rem}.link{font-size:1rem;line-height:1.4}.description{font-size:.85rem;margin:.3rem 0}.author{font-size:.8rem;margin:.3rem 0}.time{font-size:.8rem}.hr-list{margin:.5rem 0}}</style></head><body><a class=skip-link href=#main>Skip to main</a><main id=main><div class=content><header><p style=padding:0;margin:0><a href=/><b>Interesting Reads</b></a></p><ul style=padding:0;margin:0><li><a href=/about>About</a></li></ul></header><hr class=hr-list style=padding:0;margin:0><section><ul reversed class=list><li><a class=link href=https://svenschnieders.com/ title="Who shoves whom around inside the careenium?" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Who shoves whom around inside the careenium?</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=1982-03-11>1982</time></li><p class=description><strong>Douglas Hofstadter</strong> – a playful yet profound dialogue that explores the nature of selfhood, consciousness, and free will through the metaphor of the “careenium”—a chaotic yet self-organizing system of interacting elements. It asks: What is the meaning of the word &lsquo;I&rsquo;?</p><li><a class=link href=https://spectrum.ieee.org/the-case-against-quantum-computing title="The Case Against Quantum Computing" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Case Against Quantum Computing</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2018-03-11>2018</time></li><p class=description><strong>Mikhail Dyakonov</strong> – The proposed strategy for building a quantum computer relies on manipulating with high precision an unimaginably huge number of variables. That&rsquo;s very doubtful to succeed.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.sciphijournal.org/index.php/2017/11/12/why-the-culture-wins-an-appreciation-of-iain-m-banks/ title="Why the Culture Wins" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Why the Culture Wins</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2017-11-12>2017</time></li><p class=description><strong>Joseph Heath</strong> – A discussion of Iain M. Banks’ Culture series that imagines a post-scarcity utopia where technology liberates humanity from functional constraints, leaving culture as the dominant evolutionary force.</p><li><a class=link href=https://svenschnieders.com/ title="Something is wrong in the state of QED" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Something is wrong in the state of QED</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2021-03-10>2021</time></li><p class=description><strong>Oliver Consa</strong> – Quantum electrodynamics is considered the most precise theory in physics, yet its foundations rest on a single experimental value. This paper examines historical inconsistencies, mathematical sleights of hand, and hidden assumptions that challenge its accuracy.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.unqualified-reservations.org/2013/03/sam-altman-is-not-blithering-idiot/ title="Sam Altman is not a blithering idiot" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Sam Altman is not a blithering idiot</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2013-03-13>2013</time></li><p class=description><strong>Mencius Moldbug</strong> – Major parts of American cities that were thriving in 1950 have now fallen into chaos and ruin. Meanwhile, Palo Alto is full of beautiful young people adoring every detail of their new Retina iPads. Which of these phenomena is more relevant?</p><li><a class=link href=https://carcinisation.com/2020/01/27/ignorance-a-skilled-practice/ title="Ignorance, a skilled practice" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Ignorance, a skilled practice</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2020-01-27>2020</time></li><p class=description><strong>Science Banana</strong> – Exposes the global knowledge game as a fraud sustained by reified abstractions and bad metaphors. Ethnomethodology reveals meaning as irreducibly context-bound, leaving only tacit knowledge and linguistic quicksand.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.2arms1head.com/ title="Two Arms and a Head" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Two Arms and a Head</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2008-03-11>2008</time></li><p class=description><strong>Clayton Atreus</strong> – An unflinching account of the existential horror of paraplegia – both a memoir and a suicide note. About the realities of paralysis, the false optimism of disability culture, and the moral failure of a world that denies people the right to die on their own terms.</p><li><a class=link href=https://thelastpsychiatrist.com/2012/03/shame.html title=Shame target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Shame</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2012-03-12>2012</time></li><p class=description><strong>The Last Psychiatrist</strong> – Dissects sex addiction not as indulgence but as an unrelenting dialectic of desire and disgust, repetition compulsion masquerading as novelty-seeking. The pathology isn’t just in the sex but in the failed attempt at intimacy.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.theamericanconservative.com/what-long-covid-means/ title="What 'Long Covid' Means" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">What 'Long Covid' Means</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2022-03-11>2022</time></li><p class=description><strong>Peter Robinson</strong> – Long Covid illustrates how illness, culture, and psychology interact. A neurologist reflects on Havana Syndrome, Long Covid, TikTok Tourette’s, and the rise of functional neurological disorders. As media spreads awareness, it also shapes illness, blurring the …</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.lewissociety.org/innerring/ title="The Inner Ring" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Inner Ring</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=1944-03-11>1944</time></li><p class=description><strong>C. S. Lewis</strong> – We all secretly crave acceptance into the hidden circles quietly shaping our lives. Yet pursuing this invisible status often corrupts us, leaving only dissatisfaction. Genuine belonging, free from the endless chase for approval, is found elsewhere.</p></ul></section></div></main></body></html>

File: public/atom.xml

web.","thumbnailUrl":"http:\/\/localhost:1313\/resources\/_gen\/images\/library.svg","license":""}</script></head><body><a class=skip-link href=#main>Skip to main</a><main id=main><div class=content><header><p style=padding:0;margin:0><a href=/><b>Interesting Reads</b></a></p><ul style=padding:0;margin:0><li><a href=/about>About</a></li></ul></header><hr class=hr-list style=padding:0;margin:0><section><ul reversed class=list><li><a class=link href=https://svenschnieders.com/ title="Who shoves whom around inside the careenium?" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Who shoves whom around inside the careenium?</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=1982-03-11>1982</time></li><p class=description><strong>Douglas Hofstadter</strong> – a playful yet profound dialogue that explores the nature of selfhood, consciousness, and free will through the metaphor of the “careenium”—a chaotic yet self-organizing system of interacting elements. It asks: What is the meaning of the word &lsquo;I&rsquo;?</p><li><a class=link href=https://spectrum.ieee.org/the-case-against-quantum-computing title="The Case Against Quantum Computing" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Case Against Quantum Computing</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2018-03-11>2018</time></li><p class=description><strong>Mikhail Dyakonov</strong> – The proposed strategy for building a quantum computer relies on manipulating with high precision an unimaginably huge number of variables. That&rsquo;s very doubtful to succeed.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.sciphijournal.org/index.php/2017/11/12/why-the-culture-wins-an-appreciation-of-iain-m-banks/ title="Why the Culture Wins" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Why the Culture Wins</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2017-11-12>2017</time></li><p class=description><strong>Joseph Heath</strong> – A discussion of Iain M. Banks’ Culture series that imagines a post-scarcity utopia where technology liberates humanity from functional constraints, leaving culture as the dominant evolutionary force.</p><li><a class=link href=https://svenschnieders.com/ title="Something is wrong in the state of QED" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Something is wrong in the state of QED</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2021-03-10>2021</time></li><p class=description><strong>Oliver Consa</strong> – Quantum electrodynamics is considered the most precise theory in physics, yet its foundations rest on a single experimental value. This paper examines historical inconsistencies, mathematical sleights of hand, and hidden assumptions that challenge its accuracy.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.unqualified-reservations.org/2013/03/sam-altman-is-not-blithering-idiot/ title="Sam Altman is not a blithering idiot" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Sam Altman is not a blithering idiot</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2013-03-13>2013</time></li><p class=description><strong>Mencius Moldbug</strong> – Major parts of American cities that were thriving in 1950 have now fallen into chaos and ruin. Meanwhile, Palo Alto is full of beautiful young people adoring every detail of their new Retina iPads. Which of these phenomena is more relevant?</p><li><a class=link href=https://carcinisation.com/2020/01/27/ignorance-a-skilled-practice/ title="Ignorance, a skilled practice" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Ignorance, a skilled practice</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2020-01-27>2020</time></li><p class=description><strong>Science Banana</strong> – Exposes the global knowledge game as a fraud sustained by reified abstractions and bad metaphors. Ethnomethodology reveals meaning as irreducibly context-bound, leaving only tacit knowledge and linguistic quicksand.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.2arms1head.com/ title="Two Arms and a Head" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Two Arms and a Head</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2008-03-11>2008</time></li><p class=description><strong>Clayton Atreus</strong> – An unflinching account of the existential horror of paraplegia – both a memoir and a suicide note. About the realities of paralysis, the false optimism of disability culture, and the moral failure of a world that denies people the right to die on their own terms.</p><li><a class=link href=https://thelastpsychiatrist.com/2012/03/shame.html title=Shame target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">Shame</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2012-03-12>2012</time></li><p class=description><strong>The Last Psychiatrist</strong> – Dissects sex addiction not as indulgence but as an unrelenting dialectic of desire and disgust, repetition compulsion masquerading as novelty-seeking. The pathology isn’t just in the sex but in the failed attempt at intimacy.</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.theamericanconservative.com/what-long-covid-means/ title="What 'Long Covid' Means" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">What 'Long Covid' Means</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=2022-03-11>2022</time></li><p class=description><strong>Peter Robinson</strong> – Long Covid illustrates how illness, culture, and psychology interact. A neurologist reflects on Havana Syndrome, Long Covid, TikTok Tourette’s, and the rise of functional neurological disorders. As media spreads awareness, it also shapes illness, blurring the …</p><li><a class=link href=https://www.lewissociety.org/innerring/ title="The Inner Ring" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer">The Inner Ring</a><hr class=hr-list><time class="g time" datetime=1944-03-11>1944</time></li><p class=description><strong>C. S. Lewis</strong> – We all secretly crave acceptance into the hidden circles quietly shaping our lives. Yet pursuing this invisible status often corrupts us, leaving only dissatisfaction. Genuine belonging, free from the endless chase for approval, is found elsewhere.</p></ul></section></div></main></body></html>

File: CNAME

File: hugo.toml

baseURL = 'https://svensvx.github.io/interestingreads/'
languageCode = 'en-us'
title = 'Interesting Reads'
minify = true
disableHugoGeneratorInject = true

[taxonomies]
  tag = "tags"
  category = "categories"

[privacy]
  [privacy.disqus]
    disable = true
  [privacy.googleAnalytics]
    disable = true
  [privacy.instagram]
    disable = true
  [privacy.twitter]
    disable = true
  [privacy.vimeo]
    disable = true
  [privacy.youtube]
    disable = true

[params]
  description = "A curated collection of articles from around the web."
  author = "Sven"
  copyright = ""
  logo = "/resources/_gen/images/library.svg"

[frontmatter]
  date  = [":filename", ":default"]
  author = ""
  github = ""
  facebook = ""
  og_image = ""
  sitename = "Liste"
  twitter = ""

[permalinks]
  posts = "/:year/:month/:day/:filename"
  pages = "/:slug"
  photos = "/:year/:month/:day/:filename"

[outputs]
  home = ["HTML", "RSS", "JSON"]
  section = ["HTML"]

[outputFormats.RSS]
  mediatype = "application/rss"
  baseName = "atom"

[outputFormats.JSON]
  mediatype = "application/json"
  baseName = "feed"

[sitemap]
  changefreq = "monthly"
  filename = "sitemap.xml"
  priority = 0.5

[menu]
  [[menu.main]]
    identifier = "index"
    name       = "Index"
    url        = "/"
    weight     = -111

  [[menu.main]]
    identifier = "about"
    name       = "About"
    url        = "/about/"
